title: Who developed the bootstrap?
output: Mark Otto and Jacob Thornton developed bootstrap at Twitter. It was released as an open-source product in August 2011 on GitHub.

title: Is Bootstrap3 mobile-first?
output: Bootstrap 3 is the most stable version of Bootstrap, and it is still supported by the team for critical bugfixes and documentation changes. Bootstrap is more than efficient to create a responsive and mobile-first website.

title: Which of the following class in Bootstrap is used to provide a responsive fixed width container?
output: In Bootstrap, a container is used to set the content's margins dealing with the responsive behaviors of your layout. The .container class is used to create boxed content.

title: How many columns are allowed in a bootstrap grid system?
output: The Bootstrap Grid System allows up to 12 columns across the page. You can use all 12 columns individually, or you can groups the columns together to create wider columns.

title: Which of the following class in bootstrap is used to create a big box for calling extra attention?
output: A Bootstrap jumbotron specifies a big box for getting extra attention to some special content or information. It is displayed as a grey box with rounded corners. It can also enlarge the font sizes of the text inside it. The class .jumbotron within the <div> element is used to create a jumbotron.

title: The correct syntax of creating a standard navigation bar is -
output: A navigation bar is like a navigation header that is placed at the top of the page. You can collapse or extend it according to the screen size. You can create a standard navigation bar at the top of the page with <nav class='navbar navbar-default'>.

title: Which of the following is the correct syntax of creating a standard navigation tab?
output: We can create a basic navigation tab with <ul class='nav nav-tabs'>.

title: Which of the following class is used to create a black navigation bar?
The plugin used to create a cycle through elements as a slideshow is -
output: The Bootstrap carousel is a flexible, responsive way that is used to add a slider to your webpage. The carousel plugin is a component for cycling through an element, like a slideshow. If you want to add plugin functionality individually, then you have to use carousel.js file or all at once (using 'bootstrap.js' or 'bootstrap.min.js').

title: Which of the following class in Bootstrap is used to create a dropdown menu?
output: Dropdown menus are toggleable, contextual menus, used for displaying links in a list format. It facilitates users to choose one value from a predefined list. We have to wrap dropdown menu within the class .dropdown to create Bootstrap Dropdown.

title: Which of the following class in Bootstrap is used to create a basic list group?
output: The class '.list-group' within the <ul> element and the class '.list-group-item' within the <li>element are used to create a basic list group. Bootstrap list group is used to create a group of list with list items.

title: The class used to shape an image to a circle is -
output: The class .img-circle is used to shape the image into a circle (IE8 does not support rounded corners).

title: Which of the following class in Bootstrap is used to add a zebra-stripe to a table?
output: We can create different types of Bootstrap tables by using different classes to style them. The .table-striped class is used to add zebra-stripes to a table.

title: Which of the following class in Bootstrap is used to create a large button?
output: We can use the .btn-lg class in bootstrap to create a large button.

title: Which of the following plugin in Bootstrap is used to create a modal window?
output: The bootstrap modal plugin is a dialog box/popup window that is displayed on top of the current page.

title: Which of the following class in Bootstrap is used to create basic pagination?
output: Pagination is used to sort the web pages of your website in an organized manner. It becomes very necessary if your website has a lot of web pages. We can add the .pagination class to get the pagination on our page.

title: Which of the following class in Bootstrap is used to create a badge?
output: Bootstrap Badges are numerical indicators used to show that how many items are associated with the specific link. Badges are used to highlight new or unread items. The class .badge within the element is used to create badges.

title: The class in Bootstrap used to provide rounded corners to the image is -
output: The class .img-rounded is used to add rounded corners to an image (IE8 does not support rounded corners). It adds border-radius: 6px to give the image rounded corners.

title: Which of the following class in Bootstrap is used to create a panel?
output: In Bootstrap, a panel is a bordered box with some padding around its element. The class .panel is used within the <div> element to create Bootstrap panels.

title: Using which of the following, we can create a pager in Bootstrap?
output: Bootstrap pager is a form of pagination. The '.pager' class is used within the <ul> element to create the previous / next buttons. It is used to create previous and next buttons (links).
